Uses of Interface
org.jgrapes.core.EventPipeline

Packages that use EventPipeline
Package Description
org.jgrapes.core
Defines the interfaces and classes that provide the core functionality of the JGrapes event driven component framework.
org.jgrapes.core.internal
Classes implementing the public API of the library.
org.jgrapes.io
I/O related components built on top of the core package.
org.jgrapes.io.util
Utility classes, mainly for adapted buffers to specific needs.
org.jgrapes.net
Networking related I/O classes.

  • Uses of EventPipeline in org.jgrapes.core

    Methods in org.jgrapes.core that return EventPipeline
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    EventPipeline Manager.activeEventPipeline()
    Returns the pipeline used when firing an event.
    EventPipeline Manager.newEventPipeline()
    Return a new EventPipeline that processes the added events using a thread from a thread pool.
    EventPipeline Manager.newEventPipeline​(ExecutorService executorService)
    Return a new EventPipeline that processes the added events using threads from the given executor service.
    EventPipeline Manager.newSyncEventPipeline()
    Return a new EventPipeline that processes an added event (and all events caused by it) before returning from the fire(T, org.jgrapes.core.Channel...) method.
    EventPipeline EventPipeline.overrideRestriction()
    Overrides any restriction set by restrictEventSource(EventPipeline) for the next fire(Event, Channel...) invocation from the calling thread.
    EventPipeline EventPipeline.restrictEventSource​(EventPipeline sourcePipeline)
    Allow only the given source pipeline to fire events on this pipeline.
    Methods in org.jgrapes.core that return types with arguments of type EventPipeline
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Optional<EventPipeline> Event.processedBy()
    Return the event pipeline that currently processes the event (if any).
    Methods in org.jgrapes.core with parameters of type EventPipeline
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    protected void Event.handlingError​(EventPipeline eventProcessor, Throwable throwable)
    Implements the default behavior for handling events thrown by a handler.
    EventPipeline EventPipeline.restrictEventSource​(EventPipeline sourcePipeline)
    Allow only the given source pipeline to fire events on this pipeline.

    EventPipeline IOSubchannel.DefaultIOSubchannel.responsePipeline()  
    EventPipeline IOSubchannel.responsePipeline()
    Gets the EventPipeline that can be used for events going back to the initiator of this connection.
    Methods in org.jgrapes.io with parameters of type EventPipeline
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static IOSubchannel IOSubchannel.create​(Component component, EventPipeline responsePipeline)
    Creates a new subchannel of the given component’s channel with the given event pipeline and a buffer pool with two buffers sized 4096.
    Constructors in org.jgrapes.io with parameters of type EventPipeline
    Constructor Description
    DefaultIOSubchannel​(Channel mainChannel, EventPipeline responsePipeline)
    Creates a new instance with the given main channel and response pipeline.

  • Uses of EventPipeline in org.jgrapes.io.util

    Constructors in org.jgrapes.io.util with parameters of type EventPipeline
    Constructor Description
    ByteBufferOutputStream​(IOSubchannel channel, EventPipeline eventPipeline)
    Creates a new instance that uses Output events to dispatch buffers on the given channel, using the given event pipeline.
    CharBufferWriter​(IOSubchannel channel, EventPipeline eventPipeline)
    Creates a new instance that uses Output events to dispatch buffers on the given channel, using the given event pipeline.
    InputStreamPipeline​(InputStream in, IOSubchannel channel, EventPipeline eventPipeline)
    Creates a new pipeline that sends the data from the given input stream as events on the given channel, using the given event pipeline.
    LinkedIOSubchannel​(Manager hub, Channel mainChannel, IOSubchannel upstreamChannel, EventPipeline responsePipeline)
    Creates a new LinkedIOSubchannel for a given main channel that links to the give I/O subchannel.
    LinkedIOSubchannel​(Manager hub, Channel mainChannel, IOSubchannel upstreamChannel, EventPipeline responsePipeline, boolean linkBack)
    Creates a new LinkedIOSubchannel for a given main channel that links to a given I/O subchannel.
